alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 2:13PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Salt Lake...south central Morgan and western Summit Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 212 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mill Creek Canyon, or 11 miles northwest of Park City, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summit Park, Mill Creek Canyon, Emigration Canyon and Parleys Summit. This includes Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 131 and 140. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
